ifm_schema.description: Common interface management. It includes the public configuration of interfaces.

statistic-interval.description: Set the interval at which global flow statistics are collected.

ipv4-ignore-primary-sub.description: Enable/disable the function of ignoring primary/secondary of IPv4 address type. All secondary addresses must be deleted before this function is enabled.

sub-interface-link-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on all Sub-interface.

damp.description: Enable/disable suppression on interfaces' physical status flappings.

tx-off.description: Enable/disable interfaces from sending signals if the interfaces' physical status flappings are suppressed.

auto-recovery-times.description: List of automatic recovery time configuration.

time-value.description: Delay for the status transition from down to up.

interfaces.description: List of configuring information on an interface.

interface.description: Configure information on an interface. Physical, NULL, Virtual-if, and Virtual-Template0 interfaces cannot be created or deleted.

name.description: The textual name of the interface. It should be the name of the interface as assigned by the local device. It should be suitable for use in commands which entered at the device's 'console'. This might be a text name, such as 'NULL0', depending on the interface naming syntax of the device.

class.description: Identify a main interface or a sub-interface.

type.description: Type of an interface. Interfaces include physical and logical interfaces.

parent-name.description: Name of the main interface. For example, Ethernet0/1/0.

number.description: Number of an interface. For example,1, 0/1/0, or 2:1.

admin-status.description: Administrative status of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-protocol.description: Link protocol. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

router-type.description: Route attribute of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

clear-ip-df.description: Enable/disable a device to forcibly fragment IP packets on an outbound interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-up-down-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable the statistics function on an interface. The default value of this node varies according to different interface types. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-mode.description: Mode of statistics collection. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

bandwidth-type.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

bandwidth-mbps.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.

bandwidth.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

bandwidth-kbps.description: Configure the bandwidth of an interface.
Configure the bandwidth of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

mtu.description:
Maximum transmission unit of an interface.
Special explanation:
Range: The server may restrict the allowed values for this leaf, depending on the interface types.
Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

spread-mtu-flag.description: Enable/disable the function of spreading the MTU value of main interface to subinterface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-interval.description: Interval at which flow statistics are collected on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

vrf-name.description: Name of a VPN instance. It uniquely identifies a VPN instance. The VRF name of the DCN interface cannot be created, modified, or deleted.

l2-mode-enable.description: Enable/disable the function of creating an L2 Sub-interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

mac-address.description: Config MAC Address. Constraints on MAC address configuration varies according to interfaces. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

position.description: Position of an interface. For example, 0/1/0. Data can be queried only on physical interfaces.

is-l2-switch.description: To identify a layer2 switch port.

vs-name.description: Name of a VS to which an interface belongs.

l2-switch-port-index.description: L2 switch port index of an interface.

protocol-up-delay-time.description: Specify the protocol up-delay-time value in seconds.

control-flap.description: Enable/disable flapping control on an interface.

suppress.description: Suppression threshold on an interface. The value must be greater than the reusing threshold and smaller than the suppression upper limit.

reuse.description: Reusing threshold of an interface. The value must be smaller than the suppression threshold.

ceiling.description: Maximum suppression value on an interface. The value should be greater than the damping suppression threshold.

decay-ok.description: The penalty value of an Up interface attenuates to 1/2.

decay-ng.description: The penalty value of a Down interface attenuates to 1/2.

control-flap-count.description: Status suppression count of an interface.

ignore-damp.description: Configure an interface to ignore the global damp-interface function.

ignore-global-damp.description: Enable/disable an interface to ignore the global damp-interface function.

damp.description: Enable/disable suppression on an interface's physical status flappings.

tx-off.description: Enable/disable an interface suppressed due to status flapping from sending signals.

damp-state.description: Operational state of interface suppression information.

ipv4-status.description: IPv4 Protocol status of an interface.

ipv6-status.description: IPv6 protocol status of an interface.

sub-if-counts.description: Number of sub-interfaces on this interface.

receive-byte.description: Number of bytes received on an interface.

send-byte.description: Number of bytes sent on an interface.

receive-packet.description: Number of packets received on an interface.

send-packet.description: Number of packets sent on an interface.

receive-unicast-packet.description: Number of unicast packets received on an interface.

receive-multicast-packet.description: Number of multicast packets received on an interface.

receive-broad-packet.description: Number of broadcast packets received on an interface.

send-unicast-packet.description: Number of unicast packets sent on an interface.

send-multicast-packet.description: Number of multicast packets sent on an interface.

send-broad-packet.description: Number of broadcast packets sent on an interface.

receive-error-packet.description: Number of error packets received on an interface.

receive-drop-packet.description: Number of received packets discarded on an interface.

send-error-packet.description: Number of error packets sent on an interface.

send-drop-packet.description: Number of sent packets discarded on an interface.

stati-interval.description: Current interval at which interface flow statistics are collected.

in-byte-rate.description: Rate at which bytes are received within the interval.

in-bit-rate.description: Rate at which bits are received within the interval.

in-packet-rate.description: Rate at which packets are received within the interval.

in-use-rate.description: Input bandwidth usage within the interval.

out-byte-rate.description: Rate at which bytes are sent within the interval.

out-bit-rate.description: Rate at which bits are sent within the interval.

out-packet-rate.description: Rate at which packets are sent within the interval.

out-use-rate.description: Output bandwidth usage within the interval.

receive-byte.description: Number of received bytes, which can be cleared.

send-byte.description: Number of sent bytes, which can be cleared.

receive-packet.description: Number of received packets, which can be cleared.

send-packet.description: Number of sent packets, which can be cleared.

receive-unicast-packet.description: Number of received unicast packets, which can be cleared.

receive-multicast-packet.description: Number of received multicast packets, which can be cleared.

receive-broad-packet.description: Number of received broadcast packets, which can be cleared.

send-unicast-packet.description: Number of sent unicast packets, which can be cleared.

send-multicast-packet.description: Number of sent multicast packets, which can be cleared.

send-broad-packet.description: Number of sent broadcast packets, which can be cleared.

receive-error-packet.description: Number of received error packets, which can be cleared.

receive-drop-packet.description: Number of received discarded packets, which can be cleared.

send-error-packet.description: Number of sent error packets, which can be cleared.

send-drop-packet.description: Number of sent discarded packets, which can be cleared.

send-unicast-bit.description: Number of unicast bits sent on an interface.

receive-unicast-bit.description: Number of unicast bits received on an interface.

send-multicast-bit.description: Number of multicast bits sent on an interface.

receive-multicast-bit.description: Number of multicast bits received on an interface.

send-broad-bit.description: Number of broadcast bits sent on an interface.

receive-broad-bit.description: Number of broadcast bits received on an interface.

send-unicast-bit-rate.description: Rate of unicast bits sent on an interface.

receive-unicast-bit-rate.description: Rate of unicast bits received on an interface.

send-multicast-bit-rate.description: Rate of multicast bits sent on an interface.

receive-multicast-bit-rate.description: Rate of multicast bits received on an interface.

send-broad-bit-rate.description: Rate of broadcast bits sent on an interface.

receive-broad-bit-rate.description: Rate of broadcast bits received on an interface.

send-unicast-packet-rate.description: Rate of unicast packets sent on an interface.

receive-unicast-packet-rate.description: Rate of unicast packets received on an interface.

send-multicast-packet-rate.description: Rate of multicast packets sent on an interface.

receive-multicast-packet-rate.description: Rate of multicast packets received on an interface.

send-broadcast-packet-rate.description: Rate of broadcast packets sent on an interface.

receive-broadcast-packet-rate.description: Rate of broadcast packets received on an interface.

error-down.description: Information about the interface in the error-down state, including the interface name, cause of the error-down event, delay for the transition from down to up, and remaining time for the up state.

recovery-time.description: Delay for the transition from down to up.

remainder-time.description: The remaining time for the up event.

virtual-position.description: Operational state of the interface's virtual position.

ucmp.description: Enable/disable UCMP on an interface. To implement UCMP on equal-cost links with different bandwidth values, you can configure this function on each interface. Enabling or disabling UCMP on a physical interface takes effect only after the interface is restarted. UCMP is only for equal-cost routes. UCMP applies only to equal-cost routes and is independent of routing protocols, such as an IGP or BGP.

packet.description: Enable/disable per-packet load balancing on specified interfaces.

ipv4-interface-count.description: Statistics of interfaces supporting IPv4 address configuration.

physical-up-count.description: Number of IPv4 interfaces that are in the physical up state.

physical-down-count.description: Number of IPv4 interfaces that are in the physical down state.

protocol-up-count.description: Number of IPv4 interfaces that are in the protocol up state.

protocol-down-count.description: Number of IPv4 interfaces that are in the protocol down state.

remote-interfaces.description: List of statistics of remote interfaces.

last-cleared-time.description: Last time when statistics about remote interfaces were cleared.

in-bit-rate.description: Rate at which bits are received.

in-packet-rate.description: Rate at which packets are received.

in-peak-bit-rate.description: Peak rate at which bits are received.

in-peak-bit-rate-record-time.description: Time when the peak bit receive rate is reached.

out-bit-rate.description: Rate at which bits are sent.

out-packet-rate.description: Rate at which packets are sent.

out-peak-bit-rate.description: Peak rate at which bits are sent.

out-peak-bit-rate-record-time.description: Time when the peak bit send rate is reached.

statistic-interval.description: Set the interval at which global flow statistics are collected.

ipv4-ignore-primary-sub.description: Enable/disable the function of ignoring primary/secondary of IPv4 address type. All secondary addresses must be deleted before this function is enabled.

sub-interface-link-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on all Sub-interface.

damp_schema.description: Enable/disable suppression on an interface's physical status flappings.

tx-off.description: Enable/disable an interface suppressed due to status flapping from sending signals.

auto-recovery-times_schema.description: List of automatic recovery time configuration.

time-value.description: Delay for the status transition from down to up.

spread-mtu-flag.description: Enable/disable the function of spreading the MTU value of main interface to subinterface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-interval.description: Interval at which flow statistics are collected on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

vrf-name.description: Name of a VPN instance. It uniquely identifies a VPN instance. The VRF name of the DCN interface cannot be created, modified, or deleted.

l2-mode-enable.description: Enable/disable the function of creating an L2 Sub-interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

mac-address.description: Config MAC Address. Constraints on MAC address configuration varies according to interfaces. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

position.description: Position of an interface. For example, 0/1/0. Data can be queried only on physical interfaces.

is-l2-switch.description: To identify a layer2 switch port.

vs-name.description: Name of a VS to which an interface belongs.

l2-switch-port-index.description: L2 switch port index of an interface.

protocol-up-delay-time.description: Specify the protocol up-delay-time value in seconds.

control-flap.description: Enable/disable flapping control on an interface.

suppress.description: Suppression threshold on an interface. The value must be greater than the reusing threshold and smaller than the suppression upper limit.

reuse.description: Reusing threshold of an interface. The value must be smaller than the suppression threshold.

ceiling.description: Maximum suppression value on an interface. The value should be greater than the damping suppression threshold.

decay-ng.description: The penalty value of a Down interface attenuates to 1/2.

remainder-time.description: The remaining time for the up event.

virtual-position.description: Operational state of the interface's virtual position.

ucmp.description: Enable/disable UCMP on an interface. To implement UCMP on equal-cost links with different bandwidth values, you can configure this function on each interface. Enabling or disabling UCMP on a physical interface takes effect only after the interface is restarted. UCMP is only for equal-cost routes. UCMP applies only to equal-cost routes and is independent of routing protocols, such as an IGP or BGP.

packet.description: Enable/disable per-packet load balancing on specified interfaces.

name.description: The textual name of the interface. It should be the name of the interface as assigned by the local device. It should be suitable for use in commands which entered at the device's 'console'. This might be a text name, such as 'NULL0', depending on the interface naming syntax of the device.

class.description: Identify a main interface or a sub-interface.

type.description: Type of an interface. Interfaces include physical and logical interfaces.

parent-name.description: Name of the main interface. For example, Ethernet0/1/0.

number.description: Number of an interface. For example,1, 0/1/0, or 2:1.

admin-status.description: Administrative status of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-protocol.description: Link protocol. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

router-type.description: Route attribute of an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

clear-ip-df.description: Enable/disable a device to forcibly fragment IP packets on an outbound interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

link-up-down-trap-enable.description: Enable/disable the trap function on an interface. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-enable.description: Enable/disable the statistics function on an interface. The default value of this node varies according to different interface types. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.

statistic-mode.description: Mode of statistics collection. Capabilities supported by this node vary according to interface types.
